html: As Jehovah had warned Ahaz, so he warns Ahaz’ people. By calling them “these people” or “this people” (ha‘am hazzeh), Jehovah disavows their covenantal status (cf. Isaiah 6:9-10). As Ahaz proved disloyal to Jehovah, so Ahaz’ people prove disloyal to Ahaz. They favor the coalition of northern kings over the “waters of Shiloah which flow gently”—that is, over the Davidic dynasty Jehovah has appointed to rule over them. For conspiring to replace Ahaz, they will suffer worse than his rule—the rampaging River flooding beyond its borders—the king of Assyria at the height of his military power.
